column4: anyone has a guess my ubuntu is accessing many https pages except those from Last.fm? =S
just checked... last.fm seems to be down
if you're not logged in, you get a page, but my dashboard doesn't work either
have you ever tried this on your ubuntu or first time trying to get to the login/dashboard page?
i use iton a regular basis, and it works... it seems a last.fm problem atm, not yours (or mine :-) )
i, at this moment, can access the main page and even the login screen... but i'm getting "timeout"s before the hit the profile screen... =S...
i'm not sure, but i think it's the same reason why none of my scrobbler capable apps are scrobbling my musics... looks like timeout to login... =S
i have a windows machine, right here by my side, and i can login/scrobble everything from there... =S... so, is it really a last.fm problem? =S
hmmm.... could be a cache thing
but i still think it#s last.fm (they constantly have load problems)
what you mean by "cache thing"?! if its anything related to Firefox, i wouldn't agree, as i have tested it with lynx and a another text-based browser (which name a don't remember)
so what i can tell is that i've got the same same problem,,, last-exit works, but i can't log in. who knows what they did with their site

i'm using ubuntu 7.04... a friend, with the previous version, could login at a time i couldn't... i thought about missing packages, but found no logic in this, as there isn't something like "https-package".. =S...
so i fired up my windows-vm to check, and i can't log in neither
i think ill test it all a bit later... have a job to finish... anyway, thnks for the help... i'll look for your help here, later, ok?

well, maybe YOUR case is a last.fm problem... if it's is mine too, then i'm the luckless one, as i'm trying to put those things (scrobblers) to work for a month... =S... i've tested everything, from rythmbox to amarok...
